excellent: This room is working with your system, not against it. What you’re hearing is largely the equipment doing its job, with the room staying out of the way.
good: The fundamentals are solid. There are a few room influences creeping in, but nothing here is fundamentally broken or limiting enjoyment.
okay: There’s a good system trying to shine, but the room is getting involved more than it should. Addressing a couple of key areas would lift everything noticeably.
needs_work: Right now the room is in control. Most of what you’re hearing is room behaviour rather than the true character of the system.

excellent: Speaker boundary effects are minimal, so bass remains even and consistent without obvious cancellations.
good: Some boundary interference is present, but it only causes mild dips in the bass. Most notes still come through clearly.
okay: Reflections behind the speakers are starting to cancel certain bass frequencies, making some notes weaker than others.
needs_work: Strong boundary interference is causing deep bass cancellations, leading to missing notes and reduced impact in the low end.

excellent: Early reflections are well controlled, allowing stereo images to lock in place and remain stable.
good: Some early reflections are present, but they’re not seriously disrupting imaging or focus.
okay: Reflections are arriving early enough to blur imaging and soften positional cues.
needs_work: Strong early reflections are smearing detail and collapsing the stereo image.

excellent: The room supports a wide and usable frequency range, allowing the system to breathe at both ends.
good: Most of the usable bandwidth is intact, with mild roll-off or instability at the extremes.
okay: Room interaction is limiting how much of the system’s full range you can actually hear.
needs_work: The room is severely restricting low-frequency support, cutting off depth and scale.

excellent: Tonal balance is even, with no part of the spectrum drawing undue attention to itself.
good: Overall balance is respectable, though the room introduces a slight tonal bias.
okay: The room is clearly tilting the tonal balance, emphasising some frequencies while suppressing others.
needs_work: A pronounced tonal imbalance is present, making the system sound coloured or unnatural.

excellent: The frequency response is smooth and consistent, helping music flow naturally.
good: Some unevenness is present, but it’s subtle and unlikely to distract.
okay: Noticeable response irregularities are breaking continuity and drawing attention to the room.
needs_work: Severe unevenness across frequencies is fragmenting the sound and masking musical intent.

excellent: Direct sound clearly dominates, allowing fine detail and texture to come through cleanly.
good: Clarity is generally strong, with only minor masking from reflected energy.
okay: Reflections and room energy are beginning to mask detail and soften transients.
needs_work: Clarity is heavily compromised, with reflections overwhelming the direct sound.
